Body: As written in Kremer, 1997 and Štekauer, 1995 words like ‘cat-like’ or ‘congressman’ etc. have what they call suffixoids or semiaffixes. IMO, it’s kind of a dull idea, because they look like straightforward words consisting with two stems joined by the null interfix, am I right?
Title: suffixoid vs null interfix

OwnerUser.AboutMe:
Interested in computational linguistics, language typology, natural language processing.

Studied African Studies at UW in Warsaw and now studying Computer Science at UKSW.
